security_audit.summary: This skill is a documentation/guide repository containing no executable malicious code. All static findings are false positives: cryptographic terms appear in standard Apache license text and documentation; backticks are used for code formatting in markdown; URLs are legitimate MCP protocol documentation; environment variable patterns are standard configuration for MCP servers. No credential exfiltration, data theft, or command injection patterns exist.

content.user_title: Build MCP Servers for External API Integration
content.value_statement: Building MCP servers from scratch is complex without guidance on protocol requirements, tool design patterns, and evaluation strategies. This skill provides a comprehensive workflow for creating production-ready MCP servers in Python or TypeScript, covering research, implementation, review, and evaluation phases.
actual_capabilities: Guide MCP server development through four phases: research, implementation, review, and evaluation
Provide Python FastMCP and TypeScript MCP SDK implementation patterns with code examples
Create evaluation frameworks to test MCP server effectiveness with realistic scenarios
Explain agent-centric tool design principles for optimal LLM interaction
limitations: This is a guide skill that provides instructions, not executable code for running MCP servers
Does not implement specific API integrations - users must build their own based on provided patterns
Does not handle server deployment or production infrastructure concerns

prompt_templates.title: Get Started
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a basic MCP server using Python FastMCP to integrate with a REST API. Show me the minimal project structure and a hello world tool.

prompt_templates.title: Python Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to build an MCP server in Python for the GitHub API. Follow the MCP Python guide and show me how to implement pagination, authentication, and proper error handling.

prompt_templates.title: TypeScript Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an MCP server using TypeScript MCP SDK for a third-party service. Include Zod validation schemas, proper tool annotations, and response formatting options.

prompt_templates.title: Create Evaluations
prompt_templates.prompt: Create 10 evaluation questions for my MCP server that test whether LLMs can effectively use the tools. Include complex multi-step queries that require multiple tool calls.

output_examples.input: Help me create a Python MCP server for the Stripe API
output: 1. First, fetch the MCP Python SDK documentation
2. Create project structure with FastMCP server
3. Define Pydantic models for input validation
4. Implement tools for common Stripe operations

output_examples.input: What are the best practices for naming MCP tools?
output: Use snake_case for Python servers: github_create_issue
Include service prefix to avoid conflicts: slack_send_message
Use action-oriented names: get, list, search, create
Keep tools atomic and focused on single operations

best_practices: Design tools for complete workflows, not just API endpoints. Consolidate related operations into single tools where it reduces context overhead.
Follow evaluation-driven development. Create realistic test scenarios early and let agent performance drive tool improvements.
Support both JSON and Markdown response formats. JSON for programmatic processing, Markdown for human readability and quick scanning.
anti_patterns: Avoid simply wrapping every API endpoint as a separate tool. This creates tool sprawl and overwhelms LLM context windows.
Do not return exhaustive data dumps. Always truncate large results and provide filtering options to manage token usage.
Do not skip input validation. Always use Pydantic (Python) or Zod (TypeScript) models to ensure type safety and catch errors early.

faq.question: What is MCP?
faq.answer: Model Context Protocol is a standard for building servers that provide tools for LLMs to interact with external services and APIs.

faq.question: Python or TypeScript for MCP?
faq.answer: Python FastMCP is simpler for beginners. TypeScript MCP SDK offers more type safety and better integration with Node.js projects.

faq.question: How long to build an MCP server?
faq.answer: Simple integrations take a few hours. Complex APIs with many tools may take several days to research and implement properly.

faq.question: How do I test my MCP server?
faq.prompt: Use the evaluation framework to create test questions. Run them against your server to measure how effectively LLMs can use your tools.

faq.question: What makes a good MCP tool?
faq.answer: Clear names, comprehensive descriptions, proper input validation, actionable error messages, and reasonable response sizes.

faq.question: Can I use MCP with any LLM?
faq.answer: MCP is designed primarily for Claude but works with any LLM that supports the protocol specification and tool calling.
